intro: Octoknema okoubaka, commonly known as the African tamarind tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The tree produces woody pods that contain edible seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. Its bark and leaves are also valued for their medicinal properties, including anti-inflammatory and antiseptic effects. Octoknema okoubaka thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks.
